statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Marist trumps Niagara 78-64
article.story: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y. -- Jay Bowie's career-high 31 points led Marist over Niagara 78-64 on Saturday. Bowie was 11 of 14 from the field, including 4 of 6 beyond the arc, and pulled down eight rebounds. Marist (8-14, 5-7 Metro Atlantic) got 14 points from Chavaughn Lewis and Adam Kemp had 10. The first half was closely played, as Marist scored six of the final eight points of the frame to lead 38-35 at the break. But Niagara (6-17, 3-9) missed eight of its first nine shots in the second half as Marist went on an 11-0 run -- including a pair of layups by Bowie -- to open up a 12-point lead midway through. A trey by Khallid Hart at 10:35 extended that lead to 22 and though Niagara chipped away, never really challenged down the stretch. Antoine Mason led Niagara with 19 points. Marcus Ware added 14 and Marvin Jordan 12.
